  1 require 'haml/helpers'

  7 module Haml
  8   # This is the class where all the parsing and processing of the Haml
  9   # template is done. It can be directly used by the user by creating a
 10   # new instance and calling <tt>to_html</tt> to render the template. For example:
 11   #
 12   #   template = File.read('templates/really_cool_template.haml')
 13   #   haml_engine = Haml::Engine.new(template)
 14   #   output = haml_engine.to_html
 15   #   puts output
 16   class Engine
 17     # Allow access to the precompiled template
 18     attr_reader :precompiled
 19 
 20     # Allow reading and writing of the options hash
 21     attr :options, true
 22 
 23     # Designates an XHTML/XML element.
 24     ELEMENT         = ?%
 25 
 26     # Designates a <tt><div></tt> element with the given class.
 27     DIV_CLASS       = ?.
 28 
 29     # Designates a <tt><div></tt> element with the given id.
 30     DIV_ID          = ?#
 31 
 32     # Designates an XHTML/XML comment.
 33     COMMENT         = ?/
 34 
 35     # Designates an XHTML doctype.
 36     DOCTYPE         = ?!
 37 
 38     # Designates script, the result of which is output.
 39     SCRIPT          = ?=
 40 
 41     # Designates script, the result of which is flattened and output.
 42     FLAT_SCRIPT     = ?~
 43 
 44     # Designates script which is run but not output.
 45     SILENT_SCRIPT   = ?-
 46 
 47     # When following SILENT_SCRIPT, designates a comment that is not output.
 48     SILENT_COMMENT  = ?#
 49 
 50     # Designates a non-parsed line.
 51     ESCAPE          = ?\\
 52 
 53     # Designates a block of filtered text.
 54     FILTER          = ?:
 55 
 56     # Designates a non-parsed line. Not actually a character.
 57     PLAIN_TEXT      = -1
 58 
 59     # Keeps track of the ASCII values of the characters that begin a
 60     # specially-interpreted line.
 61     SPECIAL_CHARACTERS   = [
 62       ELEMENT,
 63       DIV_CLASS,
 64       DIV_ID,
 65       COMMENT,
 66       DOCTYPE,
 67       SCRIPT,
 68       FLAT_SCRIPT,
 69       SILENT_SCRIPT,
 70       ESCAPE,
 71       FILTER
 72     ]
 73 
 74     # The value of the character that designates that a line is part
 75     # of a multiline string.
 76     MULTILINE_CHAR_VALUE = ?|
 77 
 78     # Characters that designate that a multiline string may be about
 79     # to begin.
 80     MULTILINE_STARTERS   = SPECIAL_CHARACTERS - [?/]
 81 
 82     # Keywords that appear in the middle of a Ruby block with lowered
 83     # indentation. If a block has been started using indentation,
 84     # lowering the indentation  with one of these won't end the block.
 85     # For example:
 86     #
 87     #   - if foo
 88     #     %p yes!
 89     #   - else
 90     #     %p no!
 91     #
 92     # The block is ended after <tt>%p no!</tt>, because <tt>else</tt>
 93     # is a member of this array.
 94     MID_BLOCK_KEYWORDS   = ['else', 'elsif', 'rescue', 'ensure', 'when']
 95 
 96     # The Regex that matches an HTML comment command.
 97     COMMENT_REGEX = /\/(\[[\w\s\.]*\])?(.*)/
 98 
 99     # The Regex that matches a Doctype command.
100     DOCTYPE_REGEX = /(\d\.\d)?[\s]*([a-z]*)/i
101 
102     # The Regex that matches an HTML tag command.
103     TAG_REGEX = /[%]([-:\w]+)([-\w\.\#]*)(\{.*\})?(\[.*\])?([=\/\~]?)?(.*)?/
104 
105     FLAT_WARNING = <<END
106 Haml deprecation warning:
107 The ~ command is deprecated and will be removed in future Haml versions.
108 Use the :preserve filter, the preserve helper, or the find_and_preserve
109 helper instead.
110 END
111 
112     # Creates a new instace of Haml::Engine that will compile the given
113     # template string when <tt>to_html</tt> is called.
114     # See README for available options.
115     #
116     #--
117     # When adding options, remember to add information about them
118     # to README!
119     #++
120     #
121     def initialize(template, options = {})
122       @options = {
123         :suppress_eval => false,
124         :attr_wrapper => "'",
125         :locals => {},
126         :autoclose => ['meta', 'img', 'link', 'script', 'br', 'hr'],
127         :filters => {
128           'sass' => Sass::Engine,
129           'plain' => Haml::Filters::Plain,
130           'preserve' => Haml::Filters::Preserve }
131       }
132 
133       if !NOT_LOADED.include? 'redcloth'
134         @options[:filters].merge!({
135           'redcloth' => RedCloth,
136           'textile' => Haml::Filters::Textile,
137           'markdown' => Haml::Filters::Markdown
138         })
139       end
140       if !NOT_LOADED.include? 'bluecloth'
141         @options[:filters]['markdown'] = Haml::Filters::Markdown
142       end
143 
144       @options.rec_merge! options
145 
146       unless @options[:suppress_eval]
147         @options[:filters].merge!({
148           'erb' => ERB,
149           'ruby' => Haml::Filters::Ruby
150         })
151       end
152       @options[:filters].rec_merge! options[:filters] if options[:filters]
153 
154       @precompiled = @options[:precompiled]
155 
156       @template = template.strip #String
157       @to_close_stack = []
158       @output_tabs = 0
159       @template_tabs = 0
160       @index = 0
161 
162       # This is the base tabulation of the currently active
163       # flattened block. -1 signifies that there is no such block.
164       @flat_spaces = -1
165 
166       begin
167         # Only do the first round of pre-compiling if we really need to.
168         # They might be passing in the precompiled string.
169         do_precompile if @precompiled.nil? && (@precompiled = String.new)
170       rescue Haml::Error => e
171         e.add_backtrace_entry(@index, @options[:filename])
172         raise e
173       end
174     end
175 
176     # Processes the template and returns the result as a string.
177     def render(scope = Object.new, &block)
178       @scope_object = scope
179       @buffer = Haml::Buffer.new(@options)
180 
181       local_assigns = @options[:locals]
182 
183       # Get inside the view object's world
184       @scope_object.instance_eval do
185         # Set all the local assigns
186         local_assigns.each do |key,val|
187           self.class.send(:define_method, key) { val }
188         end
189       end
190 
191       # Compile the @precompiled buffer
192       compile &block
193 
194       # Return the result string
195       @buffer.buffer
196     end
197 
198     alias_method :to_html, :render
199 
200    private
201 
202     #Precompile each line
203     def do_precompile
204       push_silent <<-END
205         def _haml_render
206         _hamlout = @haml_stack[-1]
207         _erbout = _hamlout.buffer
208       END
209       
210       old_line = nil
211       old_index = nil
212       old_spaces = nil
213       old_tabs = nil
214       old_uline = nil
215       (@template + "\n-#\n-#").each_with_index do |line, index|
216         spaces, tabs = count_soft_tabs(line)
217         uline = line.lstrip[0...-1]
218         line = uline.rstrip
219         
220         if !line.empty?
221           if old_line
222             block_opened = tabs > old_tabs && !line.empty?
223             
224             suppress_render = handle_multiline(old_tabs, old_line, old_index) unless @flat_spaces != -1
225             
226             if !suppress_render
227               line_empty = old_line.empty?
228 
229               process_indent(old_tabs, old_line) unless line_empty
230               flat = @flat_spaces != -1
231 
232 
233               if !flat && old_spaces != old_tabs * 2
234                 raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Indentation: Only two space characters are allowed as tabulation.")
235               end
236 
237               if flat
238                 push_flat(old_uline, old_spaces)
239               elsif !line_empty
240                 process_line(old_line, old_index, block_opened)
241               end
242 
243               if @flat_spaces == -1 && tabs - old_tabs > 1
244                 raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Indentation: Indenting more than once per line is illegal.")
245               end
246             end
247           end
248           
249           old_line = line
250           old_index = index
251           old_spaces = spaces
252           old_tabs = tabs
253           old_uline = uline
254         elsif @flat_spaces != -1
255           process_indent(old_tabs, old_line) unless old_line.empty?
256 
257           if @flat_spaces != -1
258             push_flat(old_line, old_spaces)
259             old_line = ''
260             old_uline = ''
261             old_spaces = 0
262           end
263         end
264       end
265 
266       # Close all the open tags
267       @template_tabs.times { close }
268 
269       push_silent "end"
270     end
271     
272     # Processes and deals with lowering indentation.
273     def process_indent(count, line)
274       if count <= @template_tabs && @template_tabs > 0
275         to_close = @template_tabs - count
276 
277         to_close.times do |i|
278           offset = to_close - 1 - i
279           unless offset == 0 && mid_block_keyword?(line)
280             close
281           end
282         end
283       end
284     end
285 
286     # Processes a single line of Haml.
287     #
288     # This method doesn't return anything; it simply processes the line and
289     # adds the appropriate code to <tt>@precompiled</tt>.
290     def process_line(line, index, block_opened)
291       @index = index + 1
292       @block_opened = block_opened
293 
294       case line[0]
295       when DIV_CLASS, DIV_ID
296         render_div(line)
297       when ELEMENT
298         render_tag(line)
299       when COMMENT
300         render_comment(line)
301       when SCRIPT
302         sub_line = line[1..-1]
303         if sub_line[0] == SCRIPT
304           push_script(sub_line[1..-1].strip.dump.gsub('\\#', '#'), false)
305         else
306           push_script(sub_line, false)
307         end
308       when FLAT_SCRIPT
309         warn(FLAT_WARNING) unless defined?(Test::Unit)
310         push_flat_script(line[1..-1])
311       when SILENT_SCRIPT
312         sub_line = line[1..-1]
313         unless sub_line[0] == SILENT_COMMENT
314           mbk = mid_block_keyword?(line)
315           push_silent(sub_line, !mbk)
316           if (@block_opened && !mbk) || line[1..-1].split(' ', 2)[0] == "case"
317             push_and_tabulate([:script])
318           end
319         end
320       when FILTER
321         name = line[1..-1].downcase
322         start_filtered(options[:filters][name] || name)
323       when DOCTYPE
324         if line[0...3] == '!!!'
325           render_doctype(line)
326         else
327           push_plain line
328         end
329       when ESCAPE
330         push_plain line[1..-1]
331       else
332         push_plain line
333       end
334     end
335     
336     # Returns whether or not the line is a silent script line with one
337     # of Ruby's mid-block keywords.
338     def mid_block_keyword?(line)
339       line.length > 2 && line[0] == SILENT_SCRIPT && MID_BLOCK_KEYWORDS.include?(line[1..-1].split[0])
340     end
341 
342     # Deals with all the logic of figuring out whether a given line is
343     # the beginning, continuation, or end of a multiline sequence.
344     #
345     # This returns whether or not the line should be
346     # rendered normally.
347     def handle_multiline(count, line, index)
348       suppress_render = false
349       # Multilines are denoting by ending with a `|` (124)
350       if is_multiline?(line) && @multiline_buffer
351         # A multiline string is active, and is being continued
352         @multiline_buffer += line[0...-1]
353         suppress_render = true
354       elsif is_multiline?(line) && (MULTILINE_STARTERS.include? line[0])
355         # A multiline string has just been activated, start adding the lines
356         @multiline_buffer = line[0...-1]
357         @multiline_count = count
358         @multiline_index = index
359         process_indent(count, line)
360         suppress_render = true
361       elsif @multiline_buffer
362         # A multiline string has just ended, make line into the result
363         unless line.empty?
364           process_line(@multiline_buffer, @multiline_index, count > @multiline_count)
365           @multiline_buffer = nil
366         end
367       end
368 
369       return suppress_render
370     end
371 
372     # Checks whether or not +line+ is in a multiline sequence.
373     def is_multiline?(line)                                          # ' '[0] == 32
374       line && line.length > 1 && line[-1] == MULTILINE_CHAR_VALUE && line[-2] == 32
375     end
376 
377     # Takes <tt>@precompiled</tt>, a string buffer of Ruby code, and
378     # evaluates it in the context of <tt>@scope_object</tt>, after preparing
379     # <tt>@scope_object</tt>. The code in <tt>@precompiled</tt> populates
380     # <tt>@buffer</tt> with the compiled XHTML code.
381     def compile(&block)
382       # Set the local variables pointing to the buffer
383       buffer = @buffer
384       @scope_object.extend Haml::Helpers
385       @scope_object.instance_eval do
386         @haml_stack ||= Array.new
387         @haml_stack.push(buffer)
388 
389         class << self
390           attr :haml_lineno # :nodoc:
391         end
392       end
393 
394       begin
395         # Evaluate the buffer in the context of the scope object
396         @scope_object.instance_eval @precompiled
397         @scope_object._haml_render &block
398       rescue Exception => e
399         class << e
400           include Haml::Error
401         end
402 
403         lineno = @scope_object.haml_lineno
404 
405         # Get information from the exception and format it so that
406         # Rails can understand it.
407         compile_error = e.message.scan(/\(eval\):([0-9]*):in `[-_a-zA-Z]*': compile error/)[0]
408 
409         if compile_error
410           eval_line = compile_error[0].to_i
411           line_marker = @precompiled.split("\n")[0...eval_line].grep(/@haml_lineno = [0-9]*/)[-1]
412           lineno = line_marker.scan(/[0-9]+/)[0].to_i if line_marker
413         end
414 
415         e.add_backtrace_entry(lineno, @options[:filename])
416         raise e
417       end
418 
419       # Get rid of the current buffer
420       @scope_object.instance_eval do
421         @haml_stack.pop
422       end
423     end
424 
425     # Evaluates <tt>text</tt> in the context of <tt>@scope_object</tt>, but
426     # does not output the result.
427     def push_silent(text, add_index = false)
428       if add_index
429         @precompiled << "@haml_lineno = #{@index}\n#{text}\n"
430       else
431         # Not really DRY, but probably faster
432         @precompiled << "#{text}\n"
433       end
434     end
435 
436     # Adds <tt>text</tt> to <tt>@buffer</tt> with appropriate tabulation
437     # without parsing it.
438     def push_text(text)
439       @precompiled << "_hamlout.push_text(#{text.dump}, #{@output_tabs})\n"
440     end
441 
442     # Renders a block of text as plain text.
443     # Also checks for an illegally opened block.
444     def push_plain(text)
445       if @block_opened
446         raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Nesting: Nesting within plain text is illegal.")
447       end
448       push_text text
449     end
450 
451     # Adds +text+ to <tt>@buffer</tt> while flattening text.
452     def push_flat(text, spaces)
453       tabulation = spaces - @flat_spaces
454       tabulation = tabulation > -1 ? tabulation : 0
455       if @filter_buffer
456         @filter_buffer << "#{' ' * tabulation}#{text}\n"
457       else
458         @precompiled << "_hamlout.push_text(#{text.dump}, #{tabulation}, true)\n"
459       end
460     end
461 
462     # Causes <tt>text</tt> to be evaluated in the context of
463     # <tt>@scope_object</tt> and the result to be added to <tt>@buffer</tt>.
464     #
465     # If <tt>flattened</tt> is true, Haml::Helpers#find_and_flatten is run on
466     # the result before it is added to <tt>@buffer</tt>
467     def push_script(text, flattened)
468       unless options[:suppress_eval]
469         push_silent("haml_temp = #{text}", true)
470         out = "haml_temp = _hamlout.push_script(haml_temp, #{@output_tabs}, #{flattened})\n"
471         if @block_opened
472           push_and_tabulate([:loud, out])
473         else
474           @precompiled << out
475         end
476       end
477     end
478     
479     # Causes <tt>text</tt> to be evaluated, and Haml::Helpers#find_and_flatten
480     # to be run on it afterwards.
481     def push_flat_script(text)
482       unless text.empty?
483         push_script(text, true)
484       else
485         unless @block_opened
486           raise SyntaxError.new('Filters must have nested text.')
487         end
488         start_flat(false)
489       end
490     end
491 
492     # Closes the most recent item in <tt>@to_close_stack</tt>.
493     def close
494       tag, value = @to_close_stack.pop
495       case tag
496       when :script
497         close_block
498       when :comment
499         close_comment value
500       when :element
501         close_tag value
502       when :flat
503         close_flat value
504       when :loud
505         close_loud value
506       when :filtered
507         close_filtered value
508       end
509     end
510 
511     # Puts a line in <tt>@precompiled</tt> that will add the closing tag of
512     # the most recently opened tag.
513     def close_tag(tag)
514       @output_tabs -= 1
515       @template_tabs -= 1
516       @precompiled << "_hamlout.close_tag(#{tag.dump}, #{@output_tabs})\n"
517     end
518 
519     # Closes a Ruby block.
520     def close_block
521       push_silent "end"
522       @template_tabs -= 1
523     end
524 
525     # Closes a comment.
526     def close_comment(has_conditional)
527       @output_tabs -= 1
528       @template_tabs -= 1
529       push_silent "_hamlout.close_comment(#{has_conditional}, #{@output_tabs})"
530     end
531     
532     # Closes a flattened section.
533     def close_flat(in_tag)
534       @flat_spaces = -1
535       if in_tag
536         close
537       else
538         push_silent('_hamlout.stop_flat')
539         @template_tabs -= 1
540       end
541     end
542     
543     # Closes a loud Ruby block.
544     def close_loud(command)
545       push_silent 'end'
546       @precompiled << command
547       @template_tabs -= 1
548     end
549 
550     # Closes a filtered block.
551     def close_filtered(filter)
552       @flat_spaces = -1
553       if filter.is_a? String
554         if filter == 'redcloth' || filter == 'markdown' || filter == 'textile'
555           raise HamlError.new("You must have the RedCloth gem installed to use #{filter}")
556         else
557           raise HamlError.new("Filter \"#{filter}\" is not defined!")
558         end
559       else
560         filtered = filter.new(@filter_buffer).render
561 
562         unless filter == Haml::Filters::Preserve
563           push_text(filtered.rstrip.gsub("\n", "\n#{'  ' * @output_tabs}"))
564         else
565           push_silent("_hamlout.buffer << #{filtered.dump} << \"\\n\"\n")
566         end
567       end
568 
569       @filter_buffer = nil
570       @template_tabs -= 1
571     end
572 
573     # Parses a line that will render as an XHTML tag, and adds the code that will
574     # render that tag to <tt>@precompiled</tt>.
575     def render_tag(line)
576       matched = false
577       line.scan(TAG_REGEX) do |tag_name, attributes, attributes_hash, object_ref, action, value|
578         matched = true
579         value = value.to_s.strip
580 
581         case action
582         when '/'
583           atomic = true
584         when '=', '~'
585           parse = true
586         end
587 
588         flattened = (action == '~')
589         
590         warn(FLAT_WARNING) if flattened && !defined?(Test::Unit)
591 
592         value_exists = !value.empty?
593         attributes_hash = "{nil}" if attributes_hash.nil? || @options[:suppress_eval]
594         object_ref = "nil" unless object_ref
595 
596         if !attributes.empty? && '.#'.include?(attributes)
597           raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal element: classes and ids must have values. Use %div instead.")
598         end
599 
600         if @block_opened
601           if atomic
602             raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Nesting: Nesting within an atomic tag is illegal.")
603           elsif action == '=' || value_exists
604             raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Nesting: Nesting within a tag that already has content is illegal.")
605           end
606         elsif atomic && value_exists
607           raise SyntaxError.new("Atomic tags can't have content.")
608         elsif parse && !value_exists
609           raise SyntaxError.new("No tag content to parse.")
610         end
611 
612         if !@block_opened && !value_exists && !atomic && @options[:autoclose].include?(tag_name)
613           atomic = true
614         end
615 
616         push_silent "_hamlout.open_tag(#{tag_name.inspect}, #{@output_tabs}, #{atomic.inspect}, #{value_exists.inspect}, #{attributes.inspect}, #{object_ref}, #{flattened.inspect}, #{attributes_hash[1...-1]})", true
617 
618         unless atomic
619           push_and_tabulate([:element, tag_name])
620           @output_tabs += 1
621 
622           if value_exists
623             if parse
624               push_script(value, flattened)
625             else
626               push_text(value)
627             end
628             close
629           elsif flattened
630             start_flat(true)
631           end
632         end
633       end
634 
635       unless matched
636         raise SyntaxError.new("Invalid tag: \"#{line}\"")
637       end
638     end
639 
640     # Renders a line that creates an XHTML tag and has an implicit div because of
641     # <tt>.</tt> or <tt>#</tt>.
642     def render_div(line)
643       render_tag('%div' + line)
644     end
645 
646     # Renders an XHTML comment.
647     def render_comment(line)
648       conditional, content = line.scan(COMMENT_REGEX)[0]
649       content.strip!
650 
651       if @block_opened && !content.empty?
652         raise SyntaxError.new('Illegal Nesting: Nesting within a tag that already has content is illegal.')
653       end
654 
655       try_one_line = !content.empty?
656       push_silent "_hamlout.open_comment(#{try_one_line}, #{conditional.inspect}, #{@output_tabs})"
657       @output_tabs += 1
658       push_and_tabulate([:comment, !conditional.nil?])
659       if try_one_line
660         push_text content
661         close
662       end
663     end
664     
665     # Renders an XHTML doctype or XML shebang.
666     def render_doctype(line)
667       if @block_opened
668         raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Nesting: Nesting within a header command is illegal.")
669       end
670       line = line[3..-1].lstrip.downcase
671       if line[0...3] == "xml"
672         encoding = line.split[1] || "utf-8"
673         wrapper = @options[:attr_wrapper]
674         doctype = "<?xml version=#{wrapper}1.0#{wrapper} encoding=#{wrapper}#{encoding}#{wrapper} ?>"
675       else
676         version, type = line.scan(DOCTYPE_REGEX)[0]
677         if version == "1.1"
678           doctype = '<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">'
679         else
680           case type
681           when "strict"
682             doctype = '<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">'
683           when "frameset"
684             doctype = '<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Frameset//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-frameset.dtd">'
685           else
686             doctype = '<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">'
687           end
688         end
689       end
690       push_text doctype
691     end
692     
693     # Starts a flattened block.
694     def start_flat(in_tag)
695       # @flat_spaces is the number of indentations in the template
696       # that forms the base of the flattened area
697       if in_tag
698         @to_close_stack.push([:flat, true])
699       else
700         push_and_tabulate([:flat])
701       end
702       @flat_spaces = @template_tabs * 2
703     end
704 
705     # Starts a filtered block.
706     def start_filtered(filter)
707       unless @block_opened
708         raise SyntaxError.new('Filters must have nested text.')
709       end
710       push_and_tabulate([:filtered, filter])
711       @flat_spaces = @template_tabs * 2
712       @filter_buffer = String.new
713     end
714 
715     # Counts the tabulation of a line.
716     def count_soft_tabs(line)
717       spaces = line.index(/[^ ]/)
718       if line[spaces] == ?\t
719         raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Indentation: Only two space characters are allowed as tabulation.")
720       end
721       [spaces, spaces/2]
722     end
723     
724     # Pushes value onto <tt>@to_close_stack</tt> and increases
725     # <tt>@template_tabs</tt>.
726     def push_and_tabulate(value)
727       @to_close_stack.push(value)
728       @template_tabs += 1
729     end
730   end
731 end

Generated using the rcov code coverage analysis tool for Ruby version 0.8.0.
